column4: Anyone know the solution to the LiveCD freezing during boot process? I'm trying to install on another laptop of mine.
what's it doing when it freezes?
showing its pretty orange bar moving back and forth.
are there any other options at boot? maybe not using the default boot option, but a recovery option? I don't remember what the options are for the boot CD
i used the default option, i also tried changing the VGA resolution. still freezes.
have you tried any other live CDs that work on that laptop?
knoppix boots fine, and lots of other cds boot fine.
ok, I'm trying to find a screenshot of the initial boot screen for the ubuntu live CD, that way I can see exactly which options you have on boot
boot livecd / install, boot hard drive, and a couple others
I'm searching teh forums, trying to see if anyone has the same problems
when i first got in here i gave a link.
I'm sorry, I missed that - could you paste it for me again?
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=330118
its not my problem exactly. because no blotchy colors, its in perfect color. it just freezes during boot process.
so I understand that you get to wher you should be able to log in to the desktop, but it halts there?
ok, so you're stuck on the screen with the orange bar scrolling across the screen?
no. it freezes during the ubuntu livecd of the windows "loading bar"
the bar stops moving. and sits there forever
ok
you said you tried disabling "quiet splash" modes? (forgive me if I ask stupid questions - I'm going on too little sleep today)
no. i havent. i just tried different VGA modes
ok, check out this post: http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=1960025&postcount=4
try that and see if it gives you any kind of message that would give us clues
haha, oh no! I'll be around when you get back if you wanna try it
